abstract: New York International Children’s Film Festival has expanded and matured over years since Eric Beckman and Emily Shapiro started it in 1997; 18th annual edition is set to screen 100 films for anticipated audience of 30,000.
lead_paragraph: The American premieres of “Kahlil Gibran’s The Prophet,” a cartoon, and the live-action movie “Belle and Sebastian” are among the festival’s offerings.

headline.main: New York International Children’s Film Festival Showcases Dozens of Works
headline.print_headline: A Children’s Film Festival Comes of Age

snippet: The American premieres of “Kahlil Gibran’s The Prophet,” a cartoon, and the live-action movie “Belle and Sebastian” are among the festival’s offerings.
